image: This is the lxc image that will be launched.
name: This is the name we want the container to have. Names are always containing a number at the end.
dependencies: Here we set all the programs we want to install in all the containers via package manager. At the time only apt-get is enabled.

interfaces.name: Interface name on the container (eth0, eno1...)
interfaces.network: Network where the interface will be plugged (default => lxdbr0, else => a bridge with that name is created if it doesn't exists).
interfaces.address: If we want a static IP, this is the CIDR (AA.AA.AA.AA/MM)

forwarding: true/false if we want this container to forward IP packets.
run: List of commands we want to run on the container after installation completes. In case of replication they will be run on each container.
cmd: List of commands we want to be run everytime the container boots up. In case of replication they will be run on each container.

env.KEY: VALUE. Environment variables (KEY: VALUE) applied on each container.

scripts: Literal scripts to be run after all the containers have been launched. Here we can set container-specific commands in case of replicas.
replication: integer. If we just want a container we can wether set it to 0, 1 or ommit it. If set to 2, (p.e.) 2 containers will be created.
